name: colorLeds[i].intensity()
content:
Changes the brightness of the color LED

With [`colorLeds[index].intensity(brightness)`(#f78183)](/docs/applab/intensity/), you can control how bright or dim you want a colorLED to be with a number. The bigger the number used, the brighter the color LED.

`.intensity()` works a lot like  [`buzzer.frequency`(#f78183)](/docs/applab/buzzer.frequency/) and is just rapidly turning the light on and off, giving the illusion of dimness.

examples.name: Example: Light Dimmer

palette_params.name: brightness
palette_params.description: A number between 0-100 that controls how bright the LED will appear.

short_description: Changes the brightness of the color LED
tips: * A common usage of [`colorLeds[index].intensity(brightness)`(#f78183)](/docs/applab/intensity/) is with a slider or some sort of variable that you can easily change or update.
